channel.title: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?
channel.description:
Saw the previous post about Ljubljana and thought I'd add one.
I'm based in the Seattle area. Any other Axoloti people around?

item.title: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Cool. I'll try to make it out to an upcoming event. Thanks for the tip.

Read full topic
item.source: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?

item.title: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?
item.dc:creator: @Ersatzplanet James Husted
item.description:
@Ersatzplanet wrote:

Nicolas - There is no Synthwerks office (it is my house in Ballard). I used to put on shows as part of the Mostly Modular Trade Association that I was a founding member of, but we haven't done a show in some time. It seems like the newly started synthesizer store, Patchwerks on Eastlake Ave., has taken over the show/meet scene in the place of the MMTA. They do a great job. You can see when the next event will happen posted on their site or Facebook page. You will probably see me there.

Read full topic
item.source: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?

item.title: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Hi James. I'd be interested in getting coffee if you have the time or possibly dropping by the Synthwerks office (if there is one). I'm in Seattle as well. Are there any meetups etc. that you go to in town regularly?

Nicolas

Read full topic
item.source: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?

item.title: Any users in the Seattle area? Or USA at all?
item.dc:creator: @Ersatzplanet James Husted
item.description:
@Ersatzplanet wrote:

I'm in Seattle. I'm a former Axoloti user who plans on getting back into it as soon as I sell my Nord Modular G1 (just got a G2) and a bunch of my Eurorack rig. I also manufacture and sell Eurorack modules under the name Synthwerks.

Read full topic

What's up! Representing for the Bay Area and PDX. Building my dream machine here. 2 axo's controlled by touch interface.

boB
